intro: Pavetta bilineata, commonly known as the two-lined pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature.
